intro: Hazardia squarrosa var. grindelioides, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and narrow, gray-green leaves covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Hazardia squarrosa var. grindelioides is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities.
